hints.raw_directive:
197: A bound is **k-uniform** if it is independent of the alive walker count $k = |A_k|$. The key technical tool for proving k-uniformity is the **telescoping property** of normalized weights:
198: 
199: :::{prf:lemma} Telescoping Identity for Derivatives
200: :label: lem-telescoping-derivatives
201: 
202: For any derivative order $m \in \{1, 2, 3\}$, the localization weights satisfy:
203: 
204: $$
205: \sum_{j \in A_k} \nabla^m_{x_i} w_{ij}(\rho) = 0
206: $$
